excerpt: Buddhist pilgrimage center with 2,500 years of history, a sacred tree and an ornate temple complex.
detail_description: The Mahabodhi Temple in Bodhgaya, also known as Buddha Gaya, holds great historical and religious significance as the place where Siddhartha Gautama attained Enlightenment under the sacred Mahabodhi Tree. The temple complex, dating back to the 3rd Century BC, is a major attraction for Buddhist pilgrims and tourists alike. The present Mahabodhi Tree is a descendant of the original tree taken to Sri Lanka in the 3rd Century BC.
name: Mahabodhi Temple
address: Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Vishnupad Temple is a highly revered Hindu temple located in Gaya, Bihar, and is considered one of the most important religious sites in India. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, this temple attracts worshippers from all over the country, particularly during the pind-daan ceremony. It holds great significance and is a popular tourist attraction in Gaya, drawing visitors who seek spiritual experiences and cultural insights.
name: Vishnupad Temple
address: QXRW+FWQ, Vishnupad Rd, Nagmatia Colony, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

excerpt: Temple for devotees of Hindu goddess Sati, with carved reliefs on the 15th-century shrines & towers.
detail_description: Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth, located in Gaya, is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Sati. It is one of the 18 Maha Shakti Peethas and holds great religious importance. The temple attracts thousands of devotees during Navratri and is mentioned in various Hindu scriptures. The shrine features carved reliefs on its 15th-century shrines and towers, with two round stones representing the breasts of Sati.
name: Maa Sarva Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth Temple
address: Mangla Gauri Mandir Rd, Shakti Peetham, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Brahmayoni Hill Temple, located in Gaya, is a sacred sanctuary with a fascinating legend. The natural stone opening in the hill represents Lord Brahma's female power. To reach the temple at the hilltop, visitors must climb 424 stone steps. The site also includes two caves and an ancient temple of Astabhujadevi. Surrounded by natural beauty, it offers a peaceful atmosphere and is less crowded, making it ideal for a visit with family and friends.
name: Brahmayoni Hill
address: Maranpur, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

excerpt: Gaya is a holy city beside the Falgu River, in the northeast Indian state of Bihar. It’s known for 18th-century Vishnupad Mandir, a riverside temple with an octagonal shrine. Close by, ancient Mangla Gauri Temple is set on a hilltop. To the north, Hindu devotees bath in a Brahma Kund pond before honoring their deceased ancestors atop Pretshila Hill. To the south lies the Hindu pilgrimage center of Bodh Gaya.
detail_description: Gaya, located in the northeastern state of Bihar, is a sacred city situated next to the Falgu River. The area is famous for its 18th-century Vishnupad Mandir, a temple with an octagonal shrine by the riverside. Nearby, the ancient Mangla Gauri Temple sits atop a hilltop. To the north, visitors can witness Hindu devotees bathing in the Brahma Kund pond before paying respects to their ancestors at Pretshila Hill.
name: Gaya
address: Bihar, India

excerpt: Sacred fig tree, believed to be a descendant of the tree under which Buddha attained enlightenment.
detail_description: Bodhgaya Bodhi Tree is a significant site for Buddhists, believed to be a descendant of the original tree under which Buddha attained enlightenment. The area has been important to Buddhists since the formation of the Buddhist community. The current Bodhi tree outside the Mahabodhi temple is not the original, but a direct descendant. It has been replaced many times and is adorned with marigold flower strings during religious ceremonies.
name: Bodhgaya Bodhi Tree
address: Mocharim, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

name: Chinese Temple 中华大觉寺
address: MXWP+HV5, Domuhan-Bodhgaya Rd, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

excerpt: Ornate Thai Buddhist monastery built in 1956 housing a large Buddha statue.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bodh Gaya, Wat Thai Buddhagaya Temple is a stunning representation of Thai Buddhist architecture, constructed in 1956 to honor the 2500th Buddha Jayanti celebrations. This ornate monastery features a magnificent Buddha statue and showcases intricate designs that reflect the beauty of Thai religious art. Visitors are often captivated by its unique curved roofs and shimmering golden tiles that glisten under the sun.
name: Wat Thai Buddhagaya Temple
address: Thai temple, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Falgu River, located in Gaya, is a significant site for Hindu worship and spiritual experiences. The serene river attracts thousands of devotees who seek divine blessings at the Vishnupad Temple, which sits on its banks. Ritual bathing and peaceful boat rides are popular activities here, adding to the cultural and spiritual significance of the area. Legend has it that Rama and Sita rested on the sandy banks during their exile, further enhancing the river's mythological importance.
name: Falgu River

detail_description: The Metta Buddharam Temple, also known as the Silver Temple, is a stunning Thai temple located in Bodh Gaya. This magnificent structure features an outer shell made of stainless steel and adorned with decorative mosaic mirrors. One of its most striking features is the large white Buddha statue housed within a silver pagoda at the back of the temple. Unlike other temples in Bodh Gaya that use golden metallic colors, this temple stands out with its unique white metallic color scheme.
name: Metta Buddharam Temple
address: MXXJ+P9X, Belsar, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Located in the Pachhati locality of Bodhgaya, Bihar, the Burmese Monastery, also known as Burmese Vihara, is a popular destination for those seeking serenity and spiritual connection. This slice of Myanmar in Bodhgaya boasts distinctive Burmese architectural style and offers a peaceful retreat for visitors. The monastery is one of the many learning centers and shrines dedicated by Buddhist followers from around the world.
name: Burmese Monastery
address: Pacchati Main Road, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: The Archaeological Museum Bodhgaya, located near the Mahabodhi Temple in Bihar, is a fascinating destination for history enthusiasts. Established in 1956, this museum boasts a remarkable collection of ancient artifacts and sculptures that offer insight into the rich cultural heritage of the region. Visitors can marvel at rare antiquities such as terracotta items, stone sculptures dating back to the 1st century, and precious metal idols depicting Hindu deities.
name: Archaeological Museum Bodhgaya
address: MXVP+XX8, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

excerpt: Majestic Buddhist temple known for its richly ornate, vibrant facade, lofty prayer halls & shrines.
detail_description: Tergar Monastery is a stunning Buddhist temple with an intricately adorned exterior, grand prayer halls, and sacred shrines. Located in Bodh Gaya, it stands out for its depictions of Bhutanese royalty and the revered Zhabdrung. The monastery offers a serene atmosphere for meditation and quiet contemplation, drawing visitors from around the world. Inside, the hall is adorned with images of Buddha in a tranquil setting conducive to religious study and discussion.
name: Tergar Monastery
address: PX3M+544, Belsar, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

excerpt: Elaborate 1700s temple on an ancient site, with a footprint said to have been made by Lord Vishnu.
detail_description: The Vishnupad Temple, located in Gaya, Bihar, India, is a significant Hindu sanctuary dating back to the 1700s. It is revered for housing a footprint believed to have been made by Lord Vishnu. This temple holds great importance in Hindu mythology and serves as the final destination for the ritual of Shraddha and Pind Daan.
name: Shri Vishnupad Temple, Gaya Ji
address: Chand Chaura, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Sita Kund is a sacred pond with great significance in Hindu mythology, believed to be the bathing spot of Sita, the wife of Lord Rama, during their exile. It is a popular pilgrimage site for Hindus seeking blessings for marital harmony and paying homage to Sita.
name: Sita Kund
address: Gaya, Bihar 823003, India

detail_description: Bodhi Tree Farm (BTF) is situated near the Mahabodhi Temple, home to the sacred fig tree where Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment. This farm offers a serene environment and provides 100% pure and hygienic milk products. The staff is known for their excellent service and the dairy's white liquid is recommended for its superb taste and complete nutritional value.
name: Bodhi Tree Farm (BTF)
address: Behind DAV Cantt Area, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 823004, India

detail_description: Ramshila Hill, located in Bodh Gaya, is a picturesque destination offering breathtaking views of the surrounding area. According to local lore, it was visited by Lord Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana during their exile. The hill is steeped in historical and mythological significance, drawing pilgrims and nature lovers alike.
name: Ramshila Hill
address: Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Mangla Gauri Mandir Rd is a significant religious site in Gaya, known for being the location of the Mangla Gauri Temple, one of the 18 Maha Shakti Peethas. This temple draws in numerous worshippers daily and sees a large influx of devotees during Navratri.
name: Mangla Gauri Mandir Rd
address: Shakti Peetham, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Pind Daan Gaya is a revered site located on the banks of the Falgu River, where Hindu pilgrims partake in ancestral rituals to honor their departed ancestors. It is believed that conducting Pind Daan at this sacred location ensures the salvation of their souls. The customary practices involve offering pindas (ritual cakes) to the ancestors while reciting prayers and hymns.
name: Pind Daan Gaya
address: Vishnupad Rd, nr. PNB Bank, Chand Chaura, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Pretshila Rd, also known as "Ghost Rock," is a significant geological site with deep cultural and religious significance. Local traditions hold that this sacred rock possesses powerful properties for protecting against malevolent spirits. As a result, it attracts pilgrims and tourists seeking spiritual blessings and safeguarding.
name: Pretshila Rd
address: Bihar, India

excerpt: Bodh Gaya is a village in the northeast Indian state of Bihar. Considered one of the most important Buddhist pilgrimage sites, it's dominated by the ancient brick Mahabodhi Temple Complex, built to mark the site where the Buddha attained enlightenment beneath a sacred Bodhi Tree. A direct descendant of the tree sits within the complex today, along with six other sacred sites, including a lotus pond.
detail_description: Bodh Gaya, located in Bihar, India, is a significant Buddhist pilgrimage site. The Mahabodhi Temple Complex stands as a symbol of Buddha's enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree. This complex also houses a direct descendant of the sacred tree and other revered sites like a lotus pond. The town offers limited dining options with places like Hari Om International Cafe and Be Happy Cafe being popular choices. Litti Chokha is a traditional dish that Gaya is known for.
name: Bodh Gaya
address: Bihar, India

detail_description: Gaya Junction serves as the gateway to the enchanting city of Gaya, renowned for its spiritual significance and historical landmarks. This bustling railway station is well-connected, receiving a steady flow of trains from major Indian cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Bengaluru. Notable services include the Howrah Rajdhani Express and Maha Bodhi Express among others. As you arrive at Gaya Junction, prepare to be greeted by stunning views framed by mountains that enhance your travel experience.
name: Gaya Junction
address: 823002, Station Rd, Gol Bagicha, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: The Tibetan Refugee Market, located near the Bodhi tree in Bodh Gaya, is a bustling area offering a wide array of trinkets, souvenirs, crafts, textiles, garments and other items. Visitors can find junk jewelry, clothing and books related to Lord Buddha's teachings. This market is a paradise for shopping enthusiasts and is conveniently situated just one kilometer from the Bodhgaya bus stand.
name: Tibetan Refugee Market
address: MXVJ+P27, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Gaya International Airport, also known as Bodhgaya Airport, is a public airport located in Gaya, Bihar, India. The airport offers travelers a seamless experience with tight security measures and commendable cleanliness. Staff members are consistently helpful, enhancing the overall efficiency of airport operations. Spread over 954 acres, the airport terminal building can handle 250 departure and arrival passengers each.
name: Gaya International Airport
address: International airport, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 823004, India

detail_description: Muchalinda Sarovar Holy Pond is a significant site in Bodh Gaya, where Lord Buddha spent the sixth week meditating after achieving enlightenment. Legend has it that during a fierce thunderstorm, Muchalinda, the Snake King, protected Buddha as he meditated. The pond is also known as Lotus Pond and features a statue of Lord Buddha in Dhyan mudra. This sacred place is one of the unmissable attractions in Gaya and holds great spiritual significance for visitors.
name: Muchalinda Sarovar Holy Pond
address: Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Shri Markandey Mahadev Mandir is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its intricate architecture and religious significance. The temple, one of the oldest in Gaya, attracts pilgrims who seek divine blessings and participate in religious ceremonies. Located on the congested Gaya Bodhgaya road, it offers a peaceful and spiritual ambiance for worshipers.
name: Shri Markandey Mahadev Mandir
address: Q2F3+XJG, National Highway 83, Shakti Peetham, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Gandhi Maidan in Gaya, named after Mahatma Gandhi, offers a serene public space adorned with lush greenery. The park is perfect for outdoor activities like walking, running, and cycling. It features a children's park and exercise equipment. This sprawling area hosts various events such as exhibitions and fairs for the community and students. Additionally, it serves as the venue for Pitripaksh Mela and health camps.
name: Gandhi Maidan [Gaya]
address: Gandhi Mandap, Church Rd, Jaiprakash Nagar, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Falgu Rubber Dam, located on the Falgu River in Bodh Gaya, is a remarkable structure and a popular recreational destination. It offers a tranquil setting for picnics and leisure activities amidst lush greenery. Costing Rs 312 crore to build, this environmentally friendly dam uses rubber instead of concrete and spans 411 meters with six spans of 60-65 meters each.
name: Falgu Rubber Dam
address: Q2J6+FQ, Gewalbigha, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Muchalinda Pond, located near the Mahabodhi Temple, is a serene and historically significant spot. It features a Giant Buddha statue seated in meditation pose on a Lotus in the open air and is adjacent to the Royal Bhutan Monastery. The pond is named after Muchalinda, the snake king who sheltered Buddha during a thunderstorm while he was meditating here 2600 years ago. This peaceful location holds great spiritual significance and offers visitors an opportunity for reflection and tranquility.
name: Muchalinda Pond
address: Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231

detail_description: GAYA International Airport serves as the gateway to Bodh Gaya, a city in Bihar, India. This historical and spiritual destination is renowned as the place where Buddha achieved enlightenment. The Mahabodhi Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, stands as a major attraction drawing visitors from across the globe to explore its significance in Buddhism.
name: GAYA International Airport
address: Gaya, Bihar 823004, India

name: Akshay vat
address: Q2F2+9RG, Pushpa Rd, Shakti Peetham, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

excerpt: Popular museum featuring interactive multimedia exhibits devoted to local culture & history.
detail_description: Prachin Bharat Multimedia Museum, located near the Mahabodhi Temple in Bodhgaya, offers an immersive experience into the life and teachings of Gautam Buddha. The museum features interactive multimedia exhibits that cover his journey from childhood to attaining Nirvana, presenting historical background, geographical exposure, and the thoughts of Lord Buddha through 3D animation movies. It provides a thorough study dating back 2500 years in a visually engaging format.
name: Prachin Bharat Multimedia Museum
address: MXWR+VF2, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Vajrasana Temple, located in the city of Bodhgaya, Bihar, is a significant site with a rich history. Formerly known as Uruvela, Sambodhi and Mahabodhi, this area offers visitors a chance to immerse themselves in Buddhist architecture and cultural treasures. The region is home to numerous viharas or monasteries that are worth exploring.
name: Vajrasana Temple
address: Katorwa, Bhagalpur, Mocharim, Bodh Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

detail_description: Shri Surya Mandir, also known as the Sun Temple, is a historic site located in the village of Surajpur. The temple is dedicated to the sun god and boasts stunning stone carvings. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful atmosphere for meditation and reflection. It is a popular spot during Chhath Puja, although it can get crowded at times. The temple's location offers beautiful views of the surrounding landscape and Falgu River.
name: Shri Surya Mandir
address: R229+FQ2, Dinkarghat lane, Rana Nagar, Manpur, Bihar 823003, India

detail_description: Ramshila is one of the famous hills in Gaya, known for its spiritual significance. Along with other attractions like Yoni and Pretishila hills, as well as the caves of Deo Barabar and Pawapuri, Ramshila offers visitors a chance to immerse themselves in a spiritually enriching experience. The area also features ghats and temples along the banks of the sacred river Phalgu, making it a must-visit destination for those seeking spiritual enlightenment.
name: Ramshila
address: Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Swadeshi Vastralaya Apparels in Gaya is a highly recommended place to purchase traditional Indian clothing. The staff is known for being courteous, helpful, and friendly. Customers have enjoyed shopping here and had great experiences due to the wide range of clothes available. It's considered a good shop for various occasions including marriage functions, bridal and groom wear. The store offers great quality products with different choices at awesome prices, making it a recommended destination for purchasing quality clothing items.
name: Swadeshi Vastralaya Apparels - Best Shopping Mall in Gaya
address: Gautam Buddha Rd, opp. GPO, Durga Bari, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Jama Masjid in Gaya, Bihar is a stunning and spacious mosque with a rich history. Constructed between 1890 and 1898 by Mir Abu Saleh, it boasts eight small gates and one large entrance gate. The highlight of the mosque is its intricately carved minarets, numbering over 25. Each arched gate features exquisite floral carvings, adding to the mosque's allure.
name: Jama Masjid.جامع مسجد
address: Q2X6+P8X, Jama Masjid Rd, Murarpur, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: KALAMANDIR Music & Dance Class in Gaya, Bihar is a highly regarded institute that offers comprehensive music and dance training. Students have the opportunity to prepare for reality shows and stage performances under the guidance of supportive teachers. The institute provides excellent practice with instruments and prepares students for various programs. With experienced mentors, especially in classical music, students receive clear instruction across all subjects. This well-regarded establishment offers great opportunities for learning both music and dance.
name: KALAMANDIR Music & Dance Class
address: QXGF+V2J, Road No. 3, near Subhash Public School, Kishori Mohan Complex, Shastri Nagar, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Plaza Market is a bustling hub for all things electronic. From mobile accessories to TV repairs, this market has it all. You can find a wide variety of electrical tools and spare parts here, making it a one-stop shop for any electronic needs. Bargaining is the name of the game here, so be sure to haggle with the shopkeepers to get the best deals on items like electric fans and other gadgets.
name: Plaza Market gaya
address: Q2W5+462, Gautam Buddha Rd, Durga Bari, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: Anand Cinema is a well-known and historic establishment in Gaya, offering a superior experience compared to other local cinemas. The spacious venue includes parking facilities and small fast food corners. It consistently showcases the latest Bollywood movies and offers various shopping opportunities, including electronic home appliances, footwear, fashion brands at Reliance Trends, and other branded showrooms. Additionally, visitors can enjoy the diverse options available at the food court.
name: Anand Cinema
address: Q2V2+43H, Swarajpuri Rd, Nagmatia Colony, Gaya, Bihar 823001, India

detail_description: IndiGo Reservation Counter is a popular choice for travelers in India, offering affordable one-way fares from cities like Delhi and Kolkata. As the largest airline in India by passengers carried and fleet size, IndiGo has a significant domestic market share. The airline is known for its extensive reach and excellent customer service. Travelers can easily access contact details for IndiGo at various airports to address any concerns or complaints.
name: IndiGo Reservation Counter
address: PWXV+C86, Gaya International Airport, GAYA International Airport, Gaya, Charowa, Bihar 823004, India

detail_description: Gaden Phelgayling Namgyal Datsang, also known as the Tibetan Temple, is a revered religious center in Gaya, Bihar. It holds great significance among Hindus and Buddhists alike. The temple is adorned with Tibetan scriptures and Buddhist symbols, offering a peaceful atmosphere for visitors. Established in 1938, it houses a striking 10-meter high dharmachakra painted in golden and red hues.
name: Tibetan Temple gaden phelgayling namgyal datsang
address: Tibet Temple, Nagmatia Colony, Bodh Gaya, Gaya, Bihar 824231, India

name: Pragbodhi Cave
address: P2PW+MXQ, Bihar 823003, India

excerpt: Cave dwellings hewn from the rock by ascetics & believed to date back to around 250 BC.
detail_description: Barabar Caves, located in the Makhdumpur region of Jehanabad district, Bihar, India, are ancient cave dwellings believed to date back to around 250 BC. These rock-cut caves were used by ascetics from the Ajivika sect and some even have Ashokan inscriptions.
name: Barabar Caves
address: 2347+688, Barabar Hill Road, Barabar, Sultanpur, Bihar 804405, India

detail_description: Lomas Rishi Cave is a part of the Barabar Caves, which are the oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India dating back to the Maurya Empire. These caves were used by monks for ascetic practices and meditation, providing solitude for spiritual activities. The cave is a remarkable example of rock-cut architecture and was built during the reign of Ashoka, dedicated to the Ajivika sect.
name: Lomas Rishi Cave
address: Sultanpur, Bihar 804405, India
